RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales S. HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR ALL NOMINATED TWO-YEAR-OLD COLTS/GELDINGS THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2022 CTHS (BC DIVISION) YEARLING AND MIXED SALE, THE 2023 CTHS (BC DIVISION) HORSES OF RACING AGE SALE, AND FOR ALL NOMINATED CANADIAN BRED TWO-YEAR OLD COLTS/GELDINGS THAT PASSED THROU GH THE 2022 CTHS (ALBERTA DIVISION) SALE, 2022CTHS (MANITOBA DIVISION) SALE OR 2022 CTHS (ONTARIO DIVISION) SALE, WHERE THE FULL COMMISSION AND NOMINATION FEES WERE PAID.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AUGUST RAIN away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backside, maintained his advantage through the final turn, and held DIOCLES safely at bay late to prove best. DIOCLES settled off the early pace while racing in tight quarters at the rail entering the first turn, raced into a stalking trip just out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished determinedly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. PISCO stumbled slightly at the start, but recovered quickly and tracked the leader into the first turn, held a stalking trip in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages while holding on for a share. NORTHERN FORCE settled off the early pace while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied along the inside, and finished from along the rail in the drive, but was unable to mount a serious late bid.

ENTRY.NAME: August Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Pisco
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Diocles
ENTRY.OWNER: Wil - A - Way Farm Jewsbury Gail C and Jarvis Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales S. HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR ALL NOMINATED TWO-YEAR-OLD FILLIES THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2022 CTHS (BC DIVISION) YEARLING AND MIXED SALE, THE 2023 CTHS (BC DIVISION) HORSES OF RACING AGE SALE, AND FOR ALL NOMINATED CANADIAN BRED TWO-YEAR OLD FILLIES THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2022 CT HS (ALBERTA DIVISION) SALE, 2022CTHS (MANITOBA DIVISION) SALE OR 2022 CTHS (ONTARIO DIVISION) SALE, WHERE THE FULL COMMISSION AND NOMINATION FEES WERE PAID.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIE'S RAYNE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, shook clear of her pace rival entering he final turn, and held FEBRUARY safely at bay late to prove best. FEBRUARY eased off the leaders entering the first turn to assume a tracking trip entering the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along inside in deep stretch while brushing with the rail late in a solid debut. DONNA WYN away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of LIZZIE'S RAYNE entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished evenly three wide in the drive to garner a share. DAZ LIN FORCE hesitated at the start to get away slowly, raced into a stalking trip one out from the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but came up empty over the final furlong. FLYING MISS hesitated at the start, and broke outwards to get away poorly, and trailed the field throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzie's Rayne
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing Breen Racing Chan Eugene and Milburn Dave
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Daz Lin Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Donna Wyn
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: February
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 3 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 18000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, For Each $2,500 To $45,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: T'WASBAKKENTHEDAY away alertly and sprinted to a clear lead from along the rail in the run to the turn, maintained an insurmountable lead through the turn, and continued to stretch that margin out late under confident handling. MR MORRIS missed the break to get away poorly, chased from along the rail entering the turn, and finished from just off the rail in the drive to prove second best. NU BLEND chased the leader to the turn while racing one out from the rail, raced two wide through the turn while devoid of the early speed to force the issue, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Morris
ENTRY.COMMENT: missed break, chased rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: T'wasbakkentheday
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Nu Blend
ENTRY.OWNER: Goss Maureen Canmor Farms and Trombley Adrian
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales S. HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 76. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR ALL NOMINATED THREE-AND FOUR YEAR-OLD FILLIES WHICH PASSED THROUGH THE 2021 & 2020 CTHS (BC DIVISION) YEARLING & MIXED SALE, AND ALL THREE-AND FOUR YEAR-OLD FILLIES THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2022 CTHS (BC DIVISION) HORSES OF RACING AGE SALE AND ALL CANA DIAN BRED FILLIES THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2021 & 2020 CTHS (ALBERTA DIVISION) SALE, OR CTHS (MANITOBA DIVISION) SALE OR CTHS (ONTARIO DIVISION) SALE WHERE THE FULL COMMISSION, NOMINATION FEES, AND SUSTAINING FEES HAVE BEEN PAID.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARUNDEL CASTLE away well and tracked the pacesetter one out from the rail the first time, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, assumed command in mid stretch and was all out to hold off a late surge by MATSQUI to prevail. MATSQUI unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time, advanced smartly from along the inside midway down the backstretch, continued her move from just off the rail entering the final turn, shifted four wide in mid stretch and came up just short. LICORICE broke sharply and raced to the lead while under snug restraint entering the first turn, controlled the pace from along the rail through the second turn, battled down the backstretch from the inside of ARUNDEL CASTLE, continued that battle through the final turn and into the lane, was unable to match strides with her pace rival in deep stretch, while proving clearly best of the rest. SHAMRA away alertly and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, raced two out from the rail in the run down the backside while maintaining her position, but came up empty over the final furlong when called upon. EBONY EYES stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two wide, was forced with a four wide journey in the run down the backstretch, but failed to respond when called upon approaching the final turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Shamra
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied rail, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ebony Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Matsqui
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Elder Matt and Breen Bill
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, advanced 3/8, rallied rail, closed 4 w

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, For Each $2,500 To $45,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VECTOR away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, tugged his way up to engage the pacesetter two wide approaching the final turn, and easily swept to the lead entering the turn, and drew off under confident handling to prove much the best. HIGHLINER broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, was no match when tackled by VECTOR entering the final turn, but finished willingly to prove second best. SKYSABLAZING settled well off the early pace while racng one out from the rail entering the backside, launched her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive to get up for a share in the closing strides. FRASER LANDING away well and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide from between rivals in the lane. I C KOFFEE unhurried early, and dropped back to trail entering the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Skysablazing
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Highliner
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: I C Koffee
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Vector
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, engaged 1/4, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Fraser Landing
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales S. HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR ALL NOMINATED THREE-AND FOUR YEAR-OLD COLTS AND GELDINGS WHICH PASSED THROUGH THE 2021 & 2020 CTHS (BC DIVISION) YEARLING & MIXED SALE, AND ALL THREE-AND FOUR YEAR-OLD COLTS AND GELDINGS THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2022 CTHS (BC DIVISION) HORSES OF RACING AGE SALE AND ALL CANADIAN BRED COLTS AND GELDINGS THAT PASSED THROUGH THE 2021 & 2020 CTHS (ALBERTA DIVISION) SALE, OR CTHS (MANITOBA DIVISION) SALE OR CTHS (ONTARIO DIVISION) SALE WHERE THE FULL COMMISSION, NOMINATION FEES, AND SUSTAINING FEES HAVE BEEN PAID.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST JIMMY away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of ROCKCLIFFE entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of his pace rival in mid stretch and drew clear late. WISELY PLAYED tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held a stalking trip two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing three wide in deep stretch to get up for the place. ROCKCLIFFE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival in mid stretch, and just failed to hold the place. COUNTERACT away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, was allowed to settle well off the dueling leaders entering the backstretch, began to advance from along the rail under steady urging midway down the backstretch and into the final turn, but failed to sustain that bid in the late going. EMPEROROFTHENORTH settled off the early pace while racing at the back of the pack entering the stretch the first time, raced three wide into the second turn while trying to gain a stalking trip, dropped back to trail in the run down the backside, and wasn't persevered with late when hopelessly beaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Rockcliffe
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Emperorofthenorth
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, trailed, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Counteract
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, advanced 3/8, rallied rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2w, stalked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FILLY FATALE broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, was bumped by the loose horse approaching the second turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backside, maintained the lead through the final turn, and held TOBESUNNY safely at bay late to prove best. TOBESUNNY away well and stalked the leader into the stretch the first time while being carried out wide by the loose horse, continued down the backstretch while maintaining a stalking trip, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in he drive to get up for the place. VISENYA away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon in the drive. DONE THAT unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. PEACEHAVEN settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to save ground throughout, but failed to respond when called upon. SILVER ARROW was fractious and unprepared at the start, while still in the hands of the assistant starter, broke awkwardly and unseated her rider. Following the running of this race the stewards conducted an inquiry into the start of the race, and after review deemed that SILVER ARROW did not receive a fair start and therefore declared her a non starter.

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Bill Breen Racing and Elder Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Peacehaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared, awkward start, lost rider, declared non starter

ENTRY.NAME: Done That
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Visenya
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MILO'S COMMAND away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of SHE'S ON FIRE in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of his pace rival entering the lane, but was all out to fend off a late surge by DAPPER DON to prevail. DAPPER DON settled off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to just miss. STOLO SPIRIT settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and found her best stride late and shifted off the rail approaching the wire to just miss. SHE'S ON FIRE away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of MILO'S COMMAND entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on her pace rival entering the lane, and was outfinished late. UNION MAN broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, pulled himself into a tracking trip to loom a danger approaching the final turn, but faded in the late going. HE'S GOLDEN lagged well off the early pace while racing two wide entering the backstretch, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. PRINCESS HANNA lagged well off the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, was always well back and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Milo's Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mike T. Anderson & Terry D. Clyde

ENTRY.NAME: Stolo Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Hanna
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 3 wide, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, loomed 1/4, faded

ENTRY.NAME: He's Golden
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO $5,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED AT THE 2023 MEET AND HAVE NOT FINISHED 1ST, 2ND OR 3RD AT THE CURRENT MEET. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. (Horse s that win this condition are no longer eligible for this condition while all other starters in this condition remain eligible.)(Winning this race will not be considered in eligibility in any other condition maidens excluded). British Columbia Bred Claimi ng Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VANCOUVER'S HUNTER stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and held sway. BODEGA trailed the field into the backstretch while racing out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing four wide to get up for the place. TIMELESS SHRUG tracked the leaders from between rivals entering the backstretch, encountered traffic entering the final turn and lost position, but closed with late interest two wide in the drive to get up for a share. TIZ MEOW away alertly and stalked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, split rivals two wide approaching the final turn, dropped to the inside to launch his bid, ran into tight quarters entering the turn, and took up sharply, and never fully regained his momentum. VALUE MAX tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide from between rivals through the final turn, had the saddle slip midway through the turn, and the rider lost his irons, and was outfinished in the late going. SIR BARCLAY broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, steadily dropped back in the run to the final turn, and had little to offer late. IT'S IN COMMAND rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Meow
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked inside, rallied inside, checked 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Barclay
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, steadily retreated

ENTRY.NAME: It's in Command
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, dropped back, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, saddle slipped 3/16, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 10 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4 ,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRIKING VALUE broke sharply and dueled for the lead two wide entering the first turn, before taking control and dictating the pace in the run down the backstretch, maintained her advantage through the final turn, and was all out to fend off a late surge by TEXAS LEGACY to prevail. TEXAS LEGACY away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, launched her bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, and found her best stride late while finishing five wide in the drive to just miss. DRILL BABY DRILL tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. PERFECT PENNY settled off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, commenced her bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in the drive. STAR FINALITY away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, eased into a tracking trip two wide in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon. AUNTIE J stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a late bid when called upon. LIL'MISS INTAGLIO was slow into stride while drifting out early, trailed the field into the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. STOPSHOPPINGSHELLY lagged well off the early pace while saving ground entering the backstretch, rallied two wide into the final turn from well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lil'miss Intaglio
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow into stride, trailed, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Stopshoppingshelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged inside, rallied 2 wide, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Auntie J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 2 wide, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,
